medical_history.chief_complaint: Increasing epigastric and right-sided abdominal pain for 20 hours.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presents with a 20-hour history of increasing epigastric and right-sided abdominal pain that became severe by the time of presentation. The pain is associated with nausea and vomiting of undigested food after eating more than 6 hours ago. There was a similar episode of abdominal pain one month ago that resolved without intervention. The patient is unable to eat.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Osteoarthritis, Hypertension, Obesity, Herpes zoster with chronic left upper quadrant pain, Prolapsed bladder. Previous surgeries include left total knee replacement, right total knee replacement, and hysterectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Her father and mother both had emphysema and smoked. Her father also had bone cancer.
